content.description: on the down valley side of the boulder find the flake system starting from an undercut. fun pulling to get started in the thin flake leads to powerful laybacks between spaced openings in the crack. pinch and pull into a set up for a big move up and right to a small ledge below the lip. mantel to top out.
content.location: on the downhill/ down valley side of the bloc. note the flake/ crack on the bulging wall. descend off the back side of the bloc next to a prominent tree.

content.description: on the uphill side of the bloc, find this awesome crack line. traverse in from good holds and up to the pod. sort the feet and balance your way up into a techy finger crack sequence that leads to the top out holds. Tall and interesting throughout!
content.location: the prominent crack line on the uphill side of the boulder. lies almost on the prow and begins slightly right of the boulders edge. descend off the back of the bloc near a prominent tree.

content.description: the overhanging prow on the downvalley side of the bloc. climbs directly on the arete using holds on both sides. start standing atop small boulder at the base and work up into a great great sequence of compression moves to reach the apex of the arete. move slightly right at the very top and finish near "reflection of perfection". tall, steep, and fun moves in a great position on the bloc.
content.location: the very front prow on the boulder. start from a stand squeezing between holds on either side of the arete. descend off to the up canyon side of the bloc near a prominent tree.
